properties.text:
It is recommended you read the Garden of Glass section of the Lexica Botania before starting. Should you happen to lose this book, simply place a pebble in the crafting grid. 

Below you can find the following links to the forums and issue tracker:




If you would like your Let's Play displayed here, PM me on the forums!

You may contribute to the development of this pack via the git link.
Welcome!

Welcome to New Beginnings! NB is a skyblock built around showcasing and testing new 1.9 mods as well as providing an easycore play style for role players and building types. This book will provide information on all major mods, and it is advised that you skim through it before beginning. Content in this book will be modified every update. Don't miss out, and thanks for playing! - DrasticDemise
Mana and Magic

Your early success is tied to your ability to generate and manipulate [b]mana[/b].

Mana is stored using a [b]mana pool[/b] and can be transported from [b]mana producing flowers[/b] using a [b]mana spreader[/b].

In order to manipulate your mana spreader and flowers, it would be useful to have a [b]wand of the forest[/b].
Petal Power

With the basics down, you may begin creating your first infrastructure. The first block you will need is the [b]Petal Apothecary[/b]. The petal apothecary grants you the ability to create useful flowers. In order to operate the petal apothecary, simply fill it with water (with a bowl), toss in your petals and finally a seed.

The first flower you will want to create is the Pure Daisy. The pure daisy is necessary to convert logs and stone into their respective living parts.
More Resources

In order to obtain resources of the non-organic type, you will need to craft an [b]orechid[/b]. The orechid works similar to the pure daisy in that it consumes mana from nearby mana pools and turns stone into ores. Neat!

While you cannot obtain all types of plants through simple bonemeal, you can however transmute them using an [b]alchemy catalyst[/b], although this goal will not be obtainable until you can reach the nether. Those that wish to reach the nether would be wise to read up on the [b]fel pumpkin[/b] and the [/b][b][b]blaze lamp[/b].

The island can be a bit lonely without a small bit of wild life. Animals are a tricky thing in a void world. They require the correct biome, sufficient grass and lighting, as well as a substantial amount of time and distance from the player at all times, just to spawn!

The [b]Cocoon of Caprice[/b] will           allow you to spawn animals         as well as villagers when           given an emerald. Of course, your other option is to simply make a large grassy area and wait.
Final Notes

Without access to gravel, it would be wise to instead use a [b]fire charge[/b] to enter the nether.

All resources should be obtainable one way other another. Use [b]JEI [/b]for anything you are unsure of. 

You can enter the End through portal crafting!

Expansion of your small island can be done through the use of Terrain Crystals or the Rod of the Lands/Rod of Dirt. For any other resources, consult the lexica botania. 

Not every mod will be covered in this book, therefore it is advised you scroll through JEI to see what 1.9 has in store for you. 


Continue on to the next page!
Getting Started

Alone on this island, you may be wondering how you are to obtain basic resources. Luckily for you, it appears that the ground is exceedingly rich in small pebbles that can be obtained by clicking the ground while sneaking.

Also below you are several roots. Upon further examination, it has been concluded that the roots appear to useful for accelerating the growth of a variety of plants, similar to [b]bonemeal[/b]. When ground up, they appear to create a unique fertalizer, and when placed together appear to be able to grow a tree. [b]Do not break your last grass block before you obtain seeds.[/b]
Terrain Crystals

Terrain Crystals is a mod that allows you to create sky islands out of desired biomes. Each crystal has a set durability that decays based on the amount of blocks it has created. It is important to note that continually using the crystal on already created land will results in the land mass "growing" downwards and expanding.

Using a Terrain Crystal will not only spawn land mass, but also convert biomes into it's own biome type. For example, a plains crystal will convert the new land created by the crystal into a plains biome.

The terrain and decoration of each crystal will vary by biome type. It is also important to note that each biome's respective properties do accompany the biome change. This means that the end crystal will spawn land that does not spawn mobs other than enderman and the nether crystal will only spawn nether mobs. Biome's O PLenty biomes are supported. 

Note: You must relog in order for the biome ID and foliage color changes to occur client-side.
Blood Magic

To begin with blood magic, craft a few [b]Rudimentary Snares[/b]. Throw        the snares at a mob until you         observe white particles being given off from the mob. Once you observe the particles, slay the mobs for their [b]Demonic Will[/b]. You will need to acquire a few demonic will before continuing. Once you have acquired a few Demonic Will, create a [b]Hellfire Forge[/b]. The Hellfire Forge allows you to combine various items along with 'will' as a method of advancement through blood magic.

With the Hellfire Forge you may now begin crafting [b]Tartartic Gems[/b]. The first gem to create is the [b]Petty Tartaric Gem[/b]. Observing the recipe through JEI will show a few differences in how items are crafted. The boxes in the corners are locations for the items to be used and the box to the right requires an item that holds an amount of will. Without a tartatic gem, your only method of will is to use the demonic will obtained from mobs. Tartaric gems act immediately store demonic wills dropped from mobs and can be used in the forge.
Blood Magic Continued

Crafting rudimentary snares can be annoying and expensive, and the constant dropping of Wills can fill your inventory very quickly. To solve for both of these issues, you may craft a [b]Sentient Sword[/b]. The Sentient Sword will cause slain mobs to drain their will immediately into any held gems.

Your next poiint of progression is to craft the [b]Blood Altar[/b].           The Blood Altar is used for      all life point extractions and infusions. In order to fill the blood altar, you will need a [b]Sacrifical Dagger[/b]. Using the Sacrificial             Dagger near a blood altar will       damage you in exchange for         life essence.

Crafting through the blood altar can be done by simply placing items into the altar and providing the necessary amount of life essence.

An additional crafting method to add to your arsenal is the use of [b]Alchemy Arrays[/b]. An Alchemy Array can be started by using [b]Arcane Ashes[b][/b] on any block and giving the circle the necessary item. The first [b]Sigil[/b] that would be        wise to acquire is the                   [b]Divination Sigil[/b]. This sigil allows you to observe the current amount of life essence within a Blood Altar or network. Most sigils will drain life essence directly from your network. Additional Sigils can be obtained by observing JEI.
Blood Network

Most rituals, sigils, and enhanced items from Blood Magic require life essence directly from the player. If you attempt to use a life-essence draining item you may be damaged for the equivalent amount of life points. One unique safeguard to this is to have a resevoir of life essence in your [b]soul network[/b]. A player network is directly tied to their highest level of [b]Blood Orb[/b]. Using the blood orb will drain a bit of health in exchange for life essence. Alternatively and more efficiently, you may place the blood orb in an alter and take advantage of all forms of life essence acquisition.
Blood Altar Upgrades

The blood altar may be upgraded using various types of [b]runes[/b]. Runes allow you to customize the altar by giving it bonuses as well as increasing the amount of items that you may craft by expanding it's [b]tier[/b]. 

Placing runes around the altar in a given pattern will upgrade it's tier. In order to upgrade to Tier 2, place a hollow 3x3 of runes around the base of the altar. 

In order to expand your altar higher, it is advised that you view the wiki:
Rune Types

Blank Rune - A simple rune.
Sacrifice - Increases LP gained when sacrificing mobs.
Self-Sacrificse - Increases LP gained from self damaging.
